Here are a few recommendations based on your preferences:
1. "White Night" - This movie is about a pawnbroker who is found murdered in a remote town. Police suspect that he was murdered by an acquaintance, as even the most experienced investigator on the case could identify no signs of resistance.
Three people come under suspicion but all of them have perfect alibis and the investigation comes to a standstill.
One year later, one of them is found dead and the original murder case becomes even more mysterious. Almost fifteen years pass and the lead inspector, now approaching retirement, reflects on the only case he could not solve in an otherwise successful career.

Based on the user's preferences and movie suggestions, I recommend "Kundun," which is a historical drama film directed by Ang Lee. The movie tells the story of His Holiness the Thirteenth Dalai Lama from his birth in Lhasa, Tibet Autonomous Region to his death in 1989.
The movie features an outstanding cast, including Tenzin Thuthob Tsarong as His Holiness the Thirteenth Dalai Lama, Tulku Jamyang Kunga Tenzin as His Holiness the Fourteenth Dalai Lama, Christian Berkel as Dharma Master Yeshi, Linus Roache as Purna Lingam, Michael Landes as Yogi Swami Brahma, Sam Jaeger as Lord Krishna, Alexandra Maria Lara as Radha.
The movie was critically acclaimed and received several awards including four Academy Awards for Best Picture, Director, Actor, and Art Direction, three Golden Globes for Best Foreign Language Film, Best Director for an International Feature Film, and Best Motion Picture of the Year, one BAFTA for Best Foreign Language Film, two Satellite Awards for Best Foreign Language Film, and a Special Mention from the European Film Academy.
